overview_of_class:
This graduate-level course combines theory and application of methods of cognitive electrophysiology, specifically event-related potentials (ERPs), time-frequency electroencephalography (EEG), and electrocorticography (ECoG). Throughout class discussions of specific applications, we will consider the potential valuable of each technique, and we will work with existing datasets to implement various analysis methods. Grades will be based on in-class presentations and a final project.

Note that class meetings will begin on Tuesday, April 4th, due to the annual meeting of the Cognitive Neuroscience Society taking place on Tuesday, March 28th.
name: Topics in Brain, Behavior, and Cognition
